description.p: DeaDBeeF is an audio player for GNU/Linux and other UNIX-like systems. It is written in C with some plugins in C++. It has minimal dependencies, a native GTK2 GUI, cuesheet support, support for MP3, Ogg, FLAC, and APE, chiptune formats with subtunes, song-length databases, and more.
It is very fast and lightweight, and extensible using plugins (DSP, GUI, output, input, etc.). The GUI looks similar to Foobar2000.
